name: Survival Treatment in Hostile Environments
description: Emergency medical and survival treatment strategies for exposure to biological, chemical, and environmental hazards in high-risk areas.

cards.title: Field-Ready Antidotes & Improvised Treatments
cards.description: Using natural, locally available resources to neutralize poisons, toxins, and chemical contaminants when standard medical supplies are unavailable.
bulletpoints: Activated charcoal for absorbing ingested poisons and neutralizing toxins.
Apple cider vinegar and baking soda mixture for counteracting mild chemical burns.
Crushed plantain leaves as an emergency wound dressing with antimicrobial properties.
Honey as an antiseptic and wound barrier to prevent infection.

cards.title: Wound Care & Infection Control Without Modern Supplies
cards.description: Preventing infections and promoting healing using natural antimicrobial and wound management techniques.
bulletpoints: Honey dressings to prevent bacterial infections and speed up healing.
Clay poultices (e.g., bentonite clay) to draw out toxins and reduce inflammation.
Cauterization with heated metal or fire sterilization for deep cuts when no sutures are available.
Saltwater (saline) irrigation for cleaning wounds and preventing bacterial growth.

cards.title: Treating Radiation & Heavy Metal Poisoning in Crisis
cards.description: Emergency detox protocols for radioactive exposure and heavy metal contamination.
bulletpoints: Potassium iodide (KI) to block radioactive iodine absorption in the thyroid.
Zeolite clay and activated charcoal to bind heavy metals and remove toxins from the body.
Chlorella and spirulina for detoxifying radiation and repairing cellular damage.
Vitamin C megadosing to neutralize free radicals caused by radiation exposure.

cards.title: Respiratory Protection & Emergency Air Filtration
cards.description: Techniques for preventing inhalation of airborne biological, chemical, and radioactive particulates.
bulletpoints: Improvised gas masks using activated charcoal and cloth filters.
Creating a basic air filtration system using damp fabric to trap airborne particles.
Building a sealed room using plastic sheeting and duct tape to block airborne threats.
Breathing techniques for minimizing lung exposure in high-risk environments.

cards.title: Water Purification & Anti-Contamination Strategies
cards.description: Ensuring safe drinking water by neutralizing biological, chemical, and radioactive contaminants.
bulletpoints: Boiling water for at least 10 minutes to kill bacteria, viruses, and parasites.
Using activated charcoal to remove chemical contaminants and improve water taste.
Solar distillation (solar still) to remove heavy metals and desalinate seawater.
Iodine and chlorine dioxide tablets to purify water in emergency situations.

cards.title: Emergency Biological Threat Isolation & Quarantine
cards.description: Strategies for preventing pathogen spread in a crisis where infectious diseases or bioweapons are involved.
bulletpoints: Creating an improvised quarantine zone using plastic barriers and sealed rooms.
Using UV-C light for sterilizing small items and surfaces.
DIY (Do-It-Yourself) personal protective equipment (PPE) such as gloves, masks, and face shields.
Natural air filtration using plants that absorb toxins and release oxygen.

cards.title: Emergency Herbal Medicine for BioChem Threats
cards.description: Using plant-based medicine to counteract chemical and biological warfare threats.
bulletpoints: Garlic and oregano oil as natural antibiotics for bacterial infections.
Turmeric and black pepper for reducing inflammation and toxin buildup.
Dandelion and milk thistle to support liver detoxification from chemical exposure.
Elderberry and echinacea to strengthen the immune system against viral threats.

cards.title: Combatting Nerve Agent & Neurotoxin Exposure
cards.description: Methods for neutralizing exposure to nerve agents and neurotoxic chemicals.
bulletpoints: Atropine as an emergency antidote for organophosphate nerve agents.
Sodium bicarbonate (baking soda) to help alkalize the body and reduce toxicity.
Magnesium sulfate (Epsom salts) for nervous system support after neurotoxin exposure.
Breathing exercises to maintain oxygen flow and counteract paralysis effects.

cards.title: Decontaminating Clothing & Skin After Exposure
cards.description: Emergency decontamination protocols to remove chemical and biological agents from the body and clothing.
bulletpoints: Removing and safely disposing of contaminated clothing to prevent re-exposure.
Using a clay or activated charcoal scrub to absorb chemical toxins from skin.
Taking a cold shower with mild soap to minimize skin absorption of hazardous substances.
Rinsing eyes with saline or clean water for exposure to chemical irritants.
